circumstances: On approach to Miami Airport, the crew did not get three greens and decided to return to Sarasota. On approach, engine number one and four were shut down and both other engines at an altitude of 500 feet. The airplane belly landed and slid for 1,800 feet before coming to rest. Both crew members were uninjured while the aircraft was damaged beyond repair.
probable_cause:
Failure of the landing gear to extend properly. The following factors were reported:
- Material failure, 
- Improperly installed, 
- Inadequate maintenance and inspection, 
- Intentional wheels-up landing, 
- Suspected mechanical discrepancy, 
- Left gear uplatch upper link assembly failed, 
- Lower gear by emergency system due to improper blot installed.
